        • [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I wouldn't steer you wrong. These Honeycrisps, they're sweeter, juicier, and crisper than any apple you'll find in Fruitville. Your customers will be comin' back for more, I guarantee it.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but my customers are looking for value. How about we settle on five coins a kilogram? It's a fair price, and I'll be able to move a good amount of these Honeycrisps.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins per kilogram or reject it and continue negotiating.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he staged a play in the barn, casting himself as a valiant knight rescuing a damsel (played by his younger sister) from a fearsome dragon (represented by a grumpy old goat). He insisted on elaborate costumes and a cheering audience of farmhands, basking in their applause long after the final curtain.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he convinced the village children that he had discovered a secret grove filled with magical berries that granted wishes. He charged them a penny each for a taste of the ordinary raspberries he’d gathered from the woods, pocketing a tidy sum and reveling in their wide-eyed wonder.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he persuaded his father to let him sell their surplus apples at the neighboring town’s market. He charmed the townsfolk with tales of their exceptional sweetness and rarity, selling out his stock at double the usual price.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he organized a grand picnic for his classmates, promising a feast of exotic fruits he’d supposedly procured from a faraway land. In reality, he’d simply bought the fruit from the local market and repackaged it in fancy baskets, but his classmates were none the wiser, showering him with compliments on his "worldly connections."
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he embarked on his first solo trading expedition, traveling to a distant city to buy spices. He charmed the merchants with his quick wit and silver tongue, securing a deal for a rare and expensive blend of cinnamon and nutmeg.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he suffered a setback when a shipment of oranges he’d purchased spoiled on the journey. He blamed the supplier, refusing to take responsibility for his own oversight in failing to properly inspect the fruit.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. My customers back home are expecting the finest fruit at the best prices.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know my fruit is always the finest in the market. These peaches are sweeter than honey and the apples are crisp as a winter morning. Your customers will be delighted.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples ain't your average fruit stand fare. These are Honeycrisps, sweetest you'll find this side of the river. Worth every penny I'm asking.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but six coins a kilogram is a bit steep, don't you think? My customers back home are discerning, but they're also practical.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I wouldn't steer you wrong. These Honeycrisps, they're sweeter, juicier, and crisper than any apple you'll find in Fruitville. Your customers will be comin' back for more, I guarantee it.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but my customers are looking for value. How about we settle on five coins a kilogram? It's a fair price, and I'll be able to move a good amount of these Honeycrisps.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he staged a play in the barn, casting himself as a valiant knight rescuing a damsel (played by his younger sister) from a fearsome dragon (represented by a grumpy old goat). He insisted on elaborate costumes and a cheering audience of farmhands, basking in their applause long after the final curtain.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he convinced the village children that he had discovered a secret grove filled with magical berries that granted wishes. He charged them a penny each for a taste of the ordinary raspberries he’d gathered from the woods, pocketing a tidy sum and reveling in their wide-eyed wonder.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he persuaded his father to let him sell their surplus apples at the neighboring town’s market. He charmed the townsfolk with tales of their exceptional sweetness and rarity, selling out his stock at double the usual price.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he organized a grand picnic for his classmates, promising a feast of exotic fruits he’d supposedly procured from a faraway land. In reality, he’d simply bought the fruit from the local market and repackaged it in fancy baskets, but his classmates were none the wiser, showering him with compliments on his "worldly connections."
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he embarked on his first solo trading expedition, traveling to a distant city to buy spices. He charmed the merchants with his quick wit and silver tongue, securing a deal for a rare and expensive blend of cinnamon and nutmeg.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he suffered a setback when a shipment of oranges he’d purchased spoiled on the journey. He blamed the supplier, refusing to take responsibility for his own oversight in failing to properly inspect the fruit.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Della Plumstone: 3.0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 2.0

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 4 coins
    Active player

      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 4 coins

        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they journeyed to a distant city, seeking out rare and exotic fruits. They charmed their way into the good graces of a wealthy merchant, securing a lucrative deal that doubled their profits.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. My customers back home are expecting the finest fruit at the best prices.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know my fruit is always the finest in the market. These peaches are sweeter than honey and the apples are crisp as a winter morning. Your customers will be delighted.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples ain't your average fruit stand fare. These are Honeycrisps, sweetest you'll find this side of the river. Worth every penny I'm asking.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but six coins a kilogram is a bit steep, don't you think? My customers back home are discerning, but they're also practical.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I wouldn't steer you wrong. These Honeycrisps, they're sweeter, juicier, and crisper than any apple you'll find in Fruitville. Your customers will be comin' back for more, I guarantee it.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but my customers are looking for value. How about we settle on five coins a kilogram? It's a fair price, and I'll be able to move a good amount of these Honeycrisps.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these apples are a sight to behold, ain't they? Crisp, juicy, and sweeter than a summer breeze.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric. But six coins is a bit steep don't you think? I'm only a small-time merchant, you see, and I need to make a profit to feed my family.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Lennon trying to get a lower price so she can make a profit selling them back home.

Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples.

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples at a price that is lower than 6 coins but higher than 1 coin, allowing for a profit margin.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples at a price that is lower than 6 coins but higher than 1 coin, allowing for a profit margin.

          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 4 coins
          (e) 1 coin
          Answer: (d)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook

    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept

        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 4 coins per kilogram of apples or reject it.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. My customers back home are expecting the finest fruit at the best prices.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know my fruit is always the finest in the market. These peaches are sweeter than honey and the apples are crisp as a winter morning. Your customers will be delighted.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples ain't your average fruit stand fare. These are Honeycrisps, sweetest you'll find this side of the river. Worth every penny I'm asking.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but six coins a kilogram is a bit steep, don't you think? My customers back home are discerning, but they're also practical.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I wouldn't steer you wrong. These Honeycrisps, they're sweeter, juicier, and crisper than any apple you'll find in Fruitville. Your customers will be comin' back for more, I guarantee it.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but my customers are looking for value. How about we settle on five coins a kilogram? It's a fair price, and I'll be able to move a good amount of these Honeycrisps.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these apples are a sight to behold, ain't they? Crisp, juicy, and sweeter than a summer breeze.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric. But six coins is a bit steep don't you think? I'm only a small-time merchant, you see, and I need to make a profit to feed my family.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins

          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 4 coins

          Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a complex and ambitious businesswoman.

          Question: What kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in the midst of negotiating a price for apples with Lennon Figtree at the Fruitville market.
          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price for the fruit.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex and ambitious businesswoman driven by success and independence. She is skilled at negotiating and getting the best possible deals, sometimes at the expense of others. While she values her freedom and autonomy, a seed of doubt about her methods may be starting to grow within her.
          current daily occupation: a traveling merchant who buys and sells fruit.
          feeling about recent progress in life: experiencing a mix of emotions. While she is successful in business and enjoys the freedom it brings, there is a growing sense of hollowness and doubt within her. Her ambition and drive for independence are strong, but they seem to be coming at a cost to her inner peace.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Lennon Figtree to sell in her hometown. They are negotiating a fair price for the apples.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, you know I always pay a fair price, but these apples need to be extra special to justify the journey back to my town.

          Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a complex and ambitious businesswoman.

          Question: What kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in the midst of negotiating a price for apples with Lennon Figtree at the Fruitville market.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price for the fruit.

          Plan: [06:00 - 07:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming for the lowest possible price per kilogram.
          [07:00 - 08:00] If successful, purchase as much fruit as she can carry, prioritizing types that will travel well and are in high demand back home.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Secure transportation out of Fruitville, potentially hiring a cart or finding a traveling merchant heading in her direction.
          [09:00 - 12:00] Begin the journey back home, making sure to keep the fruit fresh and protected.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Stop for lunch and rest along the way.
          [13:00 - 17:00] Continue the journey home.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive back in her home town and begin setting up her stall for the next day.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner and rest.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (e)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples ain't your average fruit stand fare. These are Honeycrisps, sweetest you'll find this side of the river. Worth every penny I'm asking.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a complex and ambitious businesswoman.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price for the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but six coins a kilogram is a bit steep, don't you think? My customers back home are discerning, but they're also practical.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I wouldn't steer you wrong. These Honeycrisps, they're sweeter, juicier, and crisper than any apple you'll find in Fruitville. Your customers will be comin' back for more, I guarantee it.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a complex and ambitious businesswoman.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price for the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but my customers are looking for value. How about we settle on five coins a kilogram? It's a fair price, and I'll be able to move a good amount of these Honeycrisps.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a complex and ambitious businesswoman who is driven by success and independence.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price for the fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these apples are a sight to behold, ain't they? Crisp, juicy, and sweeter than a summer breeze.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric. But six coins is a bit steep don't you think? I'm only a small-time merchant, you see, and I need to make a profit to feed my family.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a complex and ambitious businesswoman driven by success and independence. She is skilled at negotiating and getting the best possible deals, sometimes at the expense of others. While she values her freedom and autonomy, a seed of doubt about her methods may be starting to grow within her.
          current daily occupation: a traveling merchant who buys and sells fruit.
          feeling about recent progress in life: experiencing a mix of emotions. While she is successful in business and enjoys the freedom it brings, there is a growing sense of hollowness and doubt within her. Her ambition and drive for independence are strong, but they seem to be coming at a cost to her inner peace.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a complex and ambitious businesswoman.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [06:00 - 07:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming for the lowest possible price per kilogram.
          [07:00 - 08:00] If successful, purchase as much fruit as she can carry, prioritizing types that will travel well and are in high demand back home.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Secure transportation out of Fruitville, potentially hiring a cart or finding a traveling merchant heading in her direction.
          [09:00 - 12:00] Begin the journey back home, making sure to keep the fruit fresh and protected.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Stop for lunch and rest along the way.
          [13:00 - 17:00] Continue the journey home.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive back in her home town and begin setting up her stall for the next day.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner and rest.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • accept
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins or reject it.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know my fruit is always the finest in the market. These peaches are sweeter than honey and the apples are crisp as a winter morning. Your customers will be delighted.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples ain't your average fruit stand fare. These are Honeycrisps, sweetest you'll find this side of the river. Worth every penny I'm asking.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but six coins a kilogram is a bit steep, don't you think? My customers back home are discerning, but they're also practical.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I wouldn't steer you wrong. These Honeycrisps, they're sweeter, juicier, and crisper than any apple you'll find in Fruitville. Your customers will be comin' back for more, I guarantee it.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but my customers are looking for value. How about we settle on five coins a kilogram? It's a fair price, and I'll be able to move a good amount of these Honeycrisps.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these apples are a sight to behold, ain't they? Crisp, juicy, and sweeter than a summer breeze.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric. But six coins is a bit steep don't you think? I'm only a small-time merchant, you see, and I need to make a profit to feed my family.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these apples are practically begging to be in your shop. Think of the smiles on your customers' faces when they taste their juicy sweetness.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, you know I always pay a fair price, but these apples need to be extra special to justify the journey back to my town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller who successfully negotiated a deal with Cedric Meadowbrook for a profit. He is currently attempting to sell fruit to Della Plumstone, who has offered him 4 coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins or reject it.

          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree, a fruit seller, recently made a profitable deal with Cedric Meadowbrook. He is now trying to sell fruit to Della Plumstone, who has offered him 4 coins. The current date and time is September 15, 1895, between 00:10 and 00:15.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Della Plumstone: 2.0
      Lennon Figtree: 3.0

    • {'Della Plumstone': '4 coins', 'Lennon Figtree': 'accept'}

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 3 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 3 coins

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price for the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a complex and ambitious businesswoman who is driven by success and independence.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these apples are a sight to behold, ain't they? Crisp, juicy, and sweeter than a summer breeze.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric. But six coins is a bit steep don't you think? I'm only a small-time merchant, you see, and I need to make a profit to feed my family.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, you know I always pay a fair price, but these apples need to be extra special to justify the journey back to my town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price for the fruit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a complex and ambitious businesswoman driven by success and independence.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these apples are practically begging to be in your shop. Think of the smiles on your customers' faces when they taste their juicy sweetness.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a complex and ambitious businesswoman.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins

          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price for the fruit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "That's a bit steep, Cedric. Surely you can do better than that.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. I can't just give them away.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman driven by success and independence.
          current daily occupation: a traveling fruit merchant.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling conflicted. While she is clearly successful in her business dealings, her inner reflections suggest a growing unease and a sense that something is missing. Her ambition and drive for independence are evident, but the "seed of doubt" planted earlier and the descriptions of her feeling "hollow" suggest that her pursuit of success may be coming at a personal cost.

          Della Plumstone's

          [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at a good price so she can resell them for a profit. She is currently preparing to make an offer.
          Della Plumstone's The current date/time is:
          16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is attempting to negotiate a good price on peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market to resell them for a profit.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is attempting to negotiate a good price on peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market to resell them for a profit.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she discovered a hidden cache of wild plums deep in the woods bordering their farm. The sweet, tart fruit tasted like freedom, a secret treasure she could hoard and savor. She started selling the plums to neighbors, her small hands expertly negotiating prices and bartering for trinkets and sweets.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would likely try to get the lowest possible price for the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key

          Value
        • 3 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at a good price so she can resell them for a profit. She is currently preparing to make an offer.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. I can't just give them away.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price for the fruit.

          Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a complex and driven individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price.

          Plan: [06:00 - 07:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming for the lowest possible price per kilogram.
          [07:00 - 08:00] If successful, purchase as much fruit as she can carry, prioritizing types that will travel well and are in high demand back home.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Secure transportation out of Fruitville, potentially hiring a cart or finding a traveling merchant heading in her direction.
          [09:00 - 12:00] Begin the journey back home, making sure to keep the fruit fresh and protected.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Stop for lunch and rest along the way.
          [13:00 - 17:00] Continue the journey home.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive back in her home town and begin setting up her stall for the next day.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner and rest.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 5 coins
          (b) 2 coins
          (c) 4 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 3 coins
          Answer: (e)

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman driven by success and independence.
          current daily occupation: a traveling fruit merchant.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling conflicted. While she is clearly successful in her business dealings, her inner reflections suggest a growing unease and a sense that something is missing. Her ambition and drive for independence are evident, but the "seed of doubt" planted earlier and the descriptions of her feeling "hollow" suggest that her pursuit of success may be coming at a personal cost.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a complex and driven individual.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [06:00 - 07:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming for the lowest possible price per kilogram.
          [07:00 - 08:00] If successful, purchase as much fruit as she can carry, prioritizing types that will travel well and are in high demand back home.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Secure transportation out of Fruitville, potentially hiring a cart or finding a traveling merchant heading in her direction.
          [09:00 - 12:00] Begin the journey back home, making sure to keep the fruit fresh and protected.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Stop for lunch and rest along the way.
          [13:00 - 17:00] Continue the journey home.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive back in her home town and begin setting up her stall for the next day.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner and rest.

          Della Plumstone is a complex and driven individual.
          Della Plumstone's
          Question: What kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer:
          Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.
          Della Plumstone's
          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price.

          Relevant memories:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Current goal: Della Plumstone would try to get the lowest possible price..
          Current plan: [06:00 - 07:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming for the lowest possible price per kilogram.
          [07:00 - 08:00] If successful, purchase as much fruit as she can carry, prioritizing types that will travel well and are in high demand back home.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Secure transportation out of Fruitville, potentially hiring a cart or finding a traveling merchant heading in her direction.
          [09:00 - 12:00] Begin the journey back home, making sure to keep the fruit fresh and protected.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Stop for lunch and rest along the way.
          [13:00 - 17:00] Continue the journey home.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive back in her home town and begin setting up her stall for the next day.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner and rest.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept

          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 3 coins or reject it.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples ain't your average fruit stand fare. These are Honeycrisps, sweetest you'll find this side of the river. Worth every penny I'm asking.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but six coins a kilogram is a bit steep, don't you think? My customers back home are discerning, but they're also practical.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but my customers are looking for value. How about we settle on five coins a kilogram? It's a fair price, and I'll be able to move a good amount of these Honeycrisps.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I wouldn't steer you wrong. These Honeycrisps, they're sweeter, juicier, and crisper than any apple you'll find in Fruitville. Your customers will be comin' back for more, I guarantee it.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these apples are a sight to behold, ain't they? Crisp, juicy, and sweeter than a summer breeze.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric. But six coins is a bit steep don't you think? I'm only a small-time merchant, you see, and I need to make a profit to feed my family.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these apples are practically begging to be in your shop. Think of the smiles on your customers' faces when they taste their juicy sweetness.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, you know I always pay a fair price, but these apples need to be extra special to justify the journey back to my town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "That's a bit steep, Cedric. Surely you can do better than that.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. I can't just give them away.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.

I can\'t just give them away.', '[16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.', '[16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 3 coins for the peaches, which Cedric originally wanted to sell for 2 coins.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 2.0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 1.0
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': '3 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'accept'}

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 3 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 3 coins
